To get started, inject the growl factory in your controller and call one of the 4 basic functions that the factory provides. The following 4 types of messages are available:

  • Warning
  • Info
  • Danger
  • Success

Place an empty div in your HTML markup with the growl directive. The growl notifications will be rendered inside the empty div. For growl like notification the location of the div in the DOM does not matter.

<div growl></div>
<div ng-controller="basicDemoCtrl">
  <button ng-click="basicUsage('warning')" type="button" class="btn btn-warning">Warning</button>
  <button ng-click="basicUsage('info')" type="button" class="btn btn-info">Info</button>
  <button ng-click="basicUsage('danger')" type="button" class="btn btn-danger">Danger</button>
  <button ng-click="basicUsage('success')" type="button" class="btn btn-success">Success</button>
</div>

demoApp = angular.module('demoApp', ['angular-growl'])

demoApp.controller('basicDemoCtrl', ['$scope', 'growl', function($scope, growl) {
  $scope.basicUsage = function(type) {
    switch (type) {
      case "success":
        growl.success("I'm a success message");
      case "info":
        growl.info("I'm an info message");
      case "warning":
        growl.warning("I'm the warning message");
      default:
        growl.error("Ups, error message here!");
    }
  };
}]);
